original_text: Reading the memoir of British Army officer Sir Adrian Carton de Wiart. In WW1, he lost an eye, a hand, was severely wounded eight times and mentioned in despatches six times. His memory of the war? 'Frankly, I enjoyed it.' He doesn't bother mentioning he won a Victoria Cross.
